byline.original: By RAYMOND DANIELL. Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

abstract: Rumanian views on Anglo-French guarantee of Rumanian borders
snippet: LONDON, April 1--When Prime Minister Chamberlain rises in the House of Commons tomorrow to review the progress of the war during the Easter recess every ear in the historic chamber will be straining to gain some clue as to how far the Allies decid...

headline.main: ALLIES TO TELL OSLO TO HALT ORE SHIPS OR NAVIES WILL ACT; Expected to Say They Prefer to Avoid Intervention, but Supplies Must Be Halted BALKAN PROBLEM ALSO UP British and French Determined to Bar Fats From Reich-- Plan to Warn Russia Too Might Shorten War ALLIES TO BID OSLO CUT NAZI ORE ROUTE Norwegian Data on Traffic Soviet Ships Already Halted Rumanians Make Complaints Nazis Warn of Reprisals

lead_paragraph: LONDON, April 1--When Prime Minister Chamberlain rises in the House of Commons tomorrow to review the progress of the war during the Easter recess every ear in the historic chamber will be straining to gain some clue as to how far the Allies decided to go at last Thursday's War Council meeting toward choking Germany by blockade.
